summary.description: A technical, 1-sentence summary of the product. No conversational filler.

gaps.description: Identified product gaps or user pain points.

story.description: Story in 'As a... I want... so that...' format.

ui_multi_section.description: Whether the UI has multiple sections

assumptions.description: Array of assumptions about the project.

out_of_scope.description: Array of items explicitly out of scope.

user_stories.title: Markdown Post Creation
user_stories.story: As an author, I want to write posts using Markdown so that I can format code and text efficiently without complex UI.
user_stories.description: Implementation of a Markdown editor with syntax highlighting and live preview in the admin panel.
acceptance_criteria: Images can be uploaded and referenced

user_stories.title: SEO Meta Management
user_stories.story: As a site owner, I want to configure meta tags for each post so that the content ranks well on search engines.
user_stories.description: Fields for custom title, description, and canonical URLs that inject into the Next.js Head component.
acceptance_criteria: Input fields for Meta Title and Description

user_stories.title: Public Comment System
user_stories.story: As a reader, I want to leave comments on posts so that I can engage with the author and community.
user_stories.description: Nested comment system with basic moderation tools and spam protection.
acceptance_criteria: Support for nested replies (1 level deep)

user_stories.title: Full-Text Search
user_stories.story: As a visitor, I want to search for keywords so that I can find relevant articles quickly.
user_stories.description: Search API endpoint querying PostgreSQL with full-text search capabilities.
acceptance_criteria: Search queries title and body content

user_stories.title: Admin Dashboard
user_stories.story: As an admin, I want a dashboard to manage content so that I can view, edit, or delete posts and users.
user_stories.description: Protected route in Next.js displaying data tables for posts, users, and analytics summaries.
acceptance_criteria: List view of all posts with status
CRUD operations for posts and users

acceptance_criteria.criteria: The platform must achieve a Lighthouse Performance score of 90+.
acceptance_criteria.description: Ensures Next.js SSR and CDN assets are optimized for Core Web Vitals.
acceptance_criteria.title: Performance Benchmark

acceptance_criteria.criteria: All user inputs must be sanitized to prevent XSS attacks.
acceptance_criteria.description: Critical for the comment system and markdown rendering.
acceptance_criteria.title: Security Sanitization

acceptance_criteria.criteria: The UI must be fully responsive across mobile, tablet, and desktop.
acceptance_criteria.description: Layout adapts using CSS Grid/Flexbox for all viewports.
acceptance_criteria.title: Mobile Responsiveness

acceptance_criteria.criteria: RSS feed must be valid and auto-update with new posts.
acceptance_criteria.description: Standard XML RSS feed accessible at /rss.xml.
acceptance_criteria.title: RSS Feed Validity

content.summary: A high-performance Next.js blog platform featuring Markdown editing, SEO tools, and a Node.js/PostgreSQL backend for scalable content management.
content.description: This project builds a robust blogging engine designed for developers and creators. It leverages Next.js for Server-Side Rendering (SSR) to ensure optimal SEO and fast load times. Key features include a Markdown-based editor, granular taxonomy (categories/tags), author profiles, and a secure Node.js API managing a PostgreSQL database, with static assets served via CDN.
assumptions: Users have basic familiarity with Markdown syntax.
PostgreSQL database is hosted on a managed service (e.g., AWS RDS, Supabase).
Authentication is handled via a standard provider or JWT implementation.
Node.js environment is version 18 or higher.

weaknesses: No WYSIWYG editor for non-technical users
Initial setup complexity compared to WordPress
threats: Rise of static site generators (Hugo, Jekyll)

stakeholders.interest: Ease of writing and publishing workflow
Code maintainability and tech stack stability

invest_analysis.comments: Complex logic for nesting and moderation.
Depends on having content to search.
Large scope, could be split further.

gaps.impact: High barrier to entry for non-technical writers.
Potential performance hit with large uploads.
Limited insights compared to Google Analytics.

opportunities.value: Increases user retention and recurring traffic.
Allows visual customization without code changes.

parts.text:
{
  "user_stories": [
    {
      "title": "Markdown Post Creation",
      "story": "As an author, I want to write posts using Markdown so that I can format code and text efficiently without complex UI.",
      "description": "Implementation of a Markdown editor with syntax highlighting and live preview in the admin panel.",
      "priority": "critical",
      "story_points": 8,
      "acceptance_criteria": [
        "Editor supports standard Markdown syntax",
        "Live preview updates in real-time",
        "Images can be uploaded and referenced",
        "Content saves to PostgreSQL database"
      ],
      "estimated_complexity": "medium",
      "user_value": "Enables technical content creation.",
      "dependencies": [],
      "id": "US-1"
    },
    {
      "title": "SEO Meta Management",
      "story": "As a site owner, I want to configure meta tags for each post so that the content ranks well on search engines.",
      "description": "Fields for custom title, description, and canonical URLs that inject into the Next.js Head component.",
      "priority": "high",
      "story_points": 3,
      "acceptance_criteria": [
        "Input fields for Meta Title and Description",
        "Open Graph tags generated automatically",
        "Sitemap.xml updates on post publish",
        "Robots.txt configuration"
      ],
      "estimated_complexity": "small",
      "user_value": "Increases organic traffic visibility.",
      "dependencies": [
        "US-1"
      ],
      "id": "US-2"
    },
    {
      "title": "Public Comment System",
      "story": "As a reader, I want to leave comments on posts so that I can engage with the author and community.",
      "description": "Nested comment system with basic moderation tools and spam protection.",
      "priority": "medium",
      "story_points": 8,
      "acceptance_criteria": [
        "Users can submit text comments",
        "Support for nested replies (1 level deep)",
        "Basic spam rate limiting",
        "Admin can delete inappropriate comments"
      ],
      "estimated_complexity": "large",
      "user_value": "Builds community engagement.",
      "dependencies": [
        "US-1"
      ],
      "id": "US-3"
    },
    {
      "title": "Full-Text Search",
      "story": "As a visitor, I want to search for keywords so that I can find relevant articles quickly.",
      "description": "Search API endpoint querying PostgreSQL with full-text search capabilities.",
      "priority": "high",
      "story_points": 5,
      "acceptance_criteria": [
        "Search bar available in header",
        "Results page displays matching posts",
        "Search queries title and body content",
        "Fast response time (<200ms)"
      ],
      "estimated_complexity": "medium",
      "user_value": "Improves content discoverability.",
      "dependencies": [
        "US-1"
      ],
      "id": "US-4"
    },
    {
      "title": "Admin Dashboard",
      "story": "As an admin, I want a dashboard to manage content so that I can view, edit, or delete posts and users.",
      "description": "Protected route in Next.js displaying data tables for posts, users, and analytics summaries.",
      "priority": "critical",
      "story_points": 13,
      "acceptance_criteria": [
        "Authentication required to access",
        "List view of all posts with status",
        "CRUD operations for posts and users",
        "Overview of site analytics"
      ],
      "estimated_complexity": "large",
      "user_value": "Centralized control of the platform.",
      "dependencies": [],
      "id": "US-5"
    }
  ],
  "acceptance_criteria": [
    {
      "criteria": "The platform must achieve a Lighthouse Performance score of 90+.",
      "description": "Ensures Next.js SSR and CDN assets are optimized for Core Web Vitals.",
      "id": "AC-1",
      "priority": "must",
      "title": "Performance Benchmark"
    },
    {
      "criteria": "All user inputs must be sanitized to prevent XSS attacks.",
      "description": "Critical for the comment system and markdown rendering.",
      "id": "AC-2",
      "priority": "must",
      "title": "Security Sanitization"
    },
    {
      "criteria": "The UI must be fully responsive across mobile, tablet, and desktop.",
      "description": "Layout adapts using CSS Grid/Flexbox for all viewports.",
      "id": "AC-3",
      "priority": "must",
      "title": "Mobile Responsiveness"
    },
    {
      "criteria": "RSS feed must be valid and auto-update with new posts.",
      "description": "Standard XML RSS feed accessible at /rss.xml.",
      "id": "AC-4",
      "priority": "should",
      "title": "RSS Feed Validity"
    }
  ],
  "summary": "A high-performance Next.js blog platform featuring Markdown editing, SEO tools, and a Node.js/PostgreSQL backend for scalable content management.",
  "description": "This project builds a robust blogging engine designed for developers and creators. It leverages Next.js for Server-Side Rendering (SSR) to ensure optimal SEO and fast load times. Key features include a Markdown-based editor, granular taxonomy (categories/tags), author profiles, and a secure Node.js API managing a PostgreSQL database, with static assets served via CDN.",
  "assumptions": [
    "Users have basic familiarity with Markdown syntax.",
    "PostgreSQL database is hosted on a managed service (e.g., AWS RDS, Supabase).",
    "Authentication is handled via a standard provider or JWT implementation.",
    "Node.js environment is version 18 or higher."
  ],
  "out_of_scope": [
    "Native mobile applications (iOS/Android).",
    "Real-time collaborative editing (Google Docs style).",
    "E-commerce or paid subscription paywalls.",
    "Multi-tenant SaaS architecture (hosting multiple blogs)."
  ],
  "swot": {
    "strengths": [
      "High performance via Next.js SSR",
      "Strong SEO capabilities out-of-the-box",
      "Scalable PostgreSQL architecture",
      "Developer-friendly Markdown workflow"
    ],
    "weaknesses": [
      "No WYSIWYG editor for non-technical users",
      "Requires developer knowledge to deploy",
      "Initial setup complexity compared to WordPress"
    ],
    "opportunities": [
      "Integration with Headless CMS APIs",
      "Plugin ecosystem for extended functionality",
      "AI-assisted content generation features",
      "Newsletter integration for audience growth"
    ],
    "threats": [
      "Dominance of established platforms (WordPress)",
      "Rise of static site generators (Hugo, Jekyll)",
      "Security vulnerabilities in user-generated content"
    ]
  },
  "stakeholders": [
    {
      "role": "Product Owner",
      "interest": "Platform adoption and content ROI",
      "influence": "high"
    },
    {
      "role": "Content Creator",
      "interest": "Ease of writing and publishing workflow",
      "influence": "high"
    },
    {
      "role": "Lead Developer",
      "interest": "Code maintainability and tech stack stability",
      "influence": "medium"
    },
    {
      "role": "SEO Specialist",
      "interest": "Search ranking and metadata control",
      "influence": "medium"
    }
  ],
  "invest_analysis": [
    {
      "user_story_id": "US-1",
      "independent": true,
      "negotiable": true,
      "valuable": true,
      "estimatable": true,
      "small": true,
      "testable": true,
      "score": 9,
      "comments": "Core feature, highly independent."
    },
    {
      "user_story_id": "US-2",
      "independent": false,
      "negotiable": true,
      "valuable": true,
      "estimatable": true,
      "small": true,
      "testable": true,
      "score": 8,
      "comments": "Depends on post creation structure."
    },
    {
      "user_story_id": "US-3",
      "independent": false,
      "negotiable": true,
      "valuable": true,
      "estimatable": true,
      "small": false,
      "testable": true,
      "score": 6,
      "comments": "Complex logic for nesting and moderation."
    },
    {
      "user_story_id": "US-4",
      "independent": false,
      "negotiable": true,
      "valuable": true,
      "estimatable": true,
      "small": true,
      "testable": true,
      "score": 7,
      "comments": "Depends on having content to search."
    },
    {
      "user_story_id": "US-5",
      "independent": true,
      "negotiable": true,
      "valuable": true,
      "estimatable": true,
      "small": false,
      "testable": true,
      "score": 5,
      "comments": "Large scope, could be split further."
    }
  ],
  "gaps": [
    {
      "gap": "Lack of WYSIWYG Editor",
      "impact": "High barrier to entry for non-technical writers.",
      "priority": "medium"
    },
    {
      "gap": "No Image Optimization Pipeline",
      "impact": "Potential performance hit with large uploads.",
      "priority": "high"
    },
    {
      "gap": "Basic Analytics Only",
      "impact": "Limited insights compared to Google Analytics.",
      "priority": "low"
    }
  ],
  "opportunities": [
    {
      "opportunity": "AI Content Assistant",
      "value": "Accelerates writing process for authors.",
      "feasibility": "medium"
    },
    {
      "opportunity": "Newsletter Integration",
      "value": "Increases user retention and recurring traffic.",
      "feasibility": "high"
    },
    {
      "opportunity": "Theme System",
      "value": "Allows visual customization without code changes.",
      "feasibility": "low"
    }
  ],
  "ui_multi_section": true
}
